nameEntry.part: Maternity allowance forms - McBride Maternity Hospital

biogHist.abstract: This series contains duplicate copies of Maternity Allowance Certificate of Registration of Birth forms for mothers who gave birth at McBride Maternity Hospital.
biogHist.p: A Research Centre Members card, obtainable at the Archives, is required to research records held at State Records.

Although some very early records relating to children in care in South Australia are open for access, most records relating to children are subject to a 100 year restriction, particularly those which contain personal information about individuals. Written permission must be obtained from the government agency which created the record in order to access restricted material. To obtain permission a Freedom of Information (FOI) request form must be submitted to the relevant government department. State Records staff will be able to assist you with this.

Under the Maternity Allowance Act 1912, mothers were entitled to a payment of 5 pounds for the birth of a live child. The scheme applied to both married and unmarried mothers, but excluded full blood Aboriginal women living a tribal way of life (1).

Information recorded on the forms includes mother's name, date and place of mother's birth, child's name, date of birth and place of birth, whether born alive or stillborn, whether child born alive lived for at least twelve hours, name and address of doctor or midwife, and signature and address of person giving information to Registrar of Births (generally the mother).
For married mothers, the forms also record full name of father, date of marriage and place of marriage. Later forms also include mother's maiden name and father's place of birth.
The forms are arranged chronologically in booklets and have a single number with an alphabetical prefix, e.g. A72001.
